StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Consortium on Asthma among African-Ancestry Populations in the Americas (CAAPA)

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO DENVERJOHNS HOPKINS UNIVERSITY

Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
The Consortium on Asthma among African-Ancestry Populations in the Americas (CAAPA) is supported by National Institutes of Health (NIH), National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI) grant R01 HL104608 and the Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico (CNPq) grant 471057/2014-2.
In addition, sections of research reported in this article were supported by: EDCTP:CT,2011,40200,025, EU-IDEA HEALTH-F3-2009-241642, TheSchistoVac,G12RR003048,HEALTH-Fe-2009-242107, EU- HL087699, HL081332, HL112656, HHSN268201300046C, HHSN268201300047C, HHSN268201300048C, HHSN268201300049C, HHSN268201300050C, HHSN268201300046C, HHSN268201300047C, HHSN268201300048C, HHSN268201300049C, HHSN268201300050C,K01HL092601, K08AI01582, K24 AI 77930, NSFGRF #1144247, P20MD006688,P50CA125183, P60MD006902, R01HG007644, R01HL087699, R01HL118267, R01HL117004, R01HL088133, R01HL004464, R01HL69167, R01HL072414, R01HL089897, R01HL089856, R01HL51492, R01HL/AI67905, R01AI079139, R01ES015794, R01HL104608, R01ES018845, , R01HL104608, R01 HL129239, R21CA178706, R21HG007233, R21HG004751, RC2HL101651, RC2HL101543, RR24975 ,S06GM008016-320107, S06GM008016-380111, S06GM08016, T32HG000044, T32GM07175, U01CA161032, 1U01HG007416-01; 1U01HG007376-01; 1U01HG007397-01; 1U01HG007417-01, U01HL109164, U01HL49596, UL1 TR00445, U19AI095230, U19 AI95227, 2M01RR010284, 331-2004, 680-2009,072405/Z/03/Z, 088862/Z/09/Z 8U54MD007588.
Authorized access to genotype data may be obtained through accession number phs001123. For the full list of investigators and institutions and for the specific cohort descriptions and descriptions regarding the collection of phenotype data that contributed to CAAPA can be found at:
https://www.caapa-project.org/
The authors wish to give special recognition to the individual CAAPA study participants who provided biological samples and or data, without their support in research none of this would be possible.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term:
There are multiple consent groups for CAAPA, corresponding to the consents in the component studies: 1) General Research Use with IRB, 2) Lung Disease, 3) Health/Medical/Biomedical, 4) Health/Medical/Biomedical with IRB, 5) Health/Medical/Biomedical with IRB for non-profit institutions only, 6) Focused Disease Only with IRB and 7) Focused Disease Only with IRB for non-profit institutions only.
For the Lung Disease group (#2 above): Informed consent restrict the use of data analysis related to lung diseases including asthma/allergies (immunologic disease), asthma related traits(e.g., obesity), drug response, genetic ancestry to adjust for differences between cases and controls and to identify new genes related to clinical phenotypes.
The Focused Disease Groups (#6&7 above) allow for study of blood pressure, heart or other cardiovascular disease, obesity, diabetes, kidney disease, or lung disease and risk factors for these diseases only. Use of these data to study other diseases (e.g. cancer, schizophrenia) is NOT allowed under the current consent.
For the consent groups requiring IRB documentation (#1 and #4-7), please note that only full or expedited approvals will be accepted.
For groups #4-7, these data may not be used to investigate individual pedigree structures or individual participant genotypes for the purpose of identifying individuals or families; assess variables or proxies that could be considered as stigmatizing an individual or a group; perform phenotype-only analyses (note: investigators may request data for such phenotype-only analyses through NHLBI’s BioLINCC); or explore issues such as non-maternity and non-paternity. All research must be related to the etiology and prevention of morbidity and mortality of the U.S. Population consistent with the demographic distribution in this Study.

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Lung Disease)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-LD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Lung Disease.
Informed consent restrict the use of data analysis related to lung diseases including asthma/allergies (immunologic disease), asthma related traits(e.g., obesity), drug response, genetic ancestry to adjust for differences between cases and controls and to identify new genes related to clinical phenotypes.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical
ConsentGroup.name: HMB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
These data may not be used to investigate individual pedigree structures or individual participant genotypes for the purpose of identifying individuals or families; assess variables or proxies that could be considered as stigmatizing an individual or a group; perform phenotype-only analyses (note: investigators may request data for such phenotype-only analyses through NHLBI’s BioLINCC); or explore issues such as non-maternity and non-paternity. All research must be related to the etiology and prevention of morbidity and mortality of the U.S. Population consistent with the demographic distribution in this study.
Data users will be required to obtain IRB approval for their projects from their respective institutions (please note that only full or expedited approvals will be accepted).

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
These data may not be used to investigate individual pedigree structures or individual participant genotypes for the purpose of identifying individuals or families; assess variables or proxies that could be considered as stigmatizing an individual or a group; perform phenotype-only analyses (note: investigators may request data for such phenotype-only analyses through NHLBI’s BioLINCC); or explore issues such as non-maternity and non-paternity. All research must be related to the etiology and prevention of morbidity and mortality of the U.S. Population consistent with the demographic distribution in this Study.
Data users will be required to obtain IRB approval for their projects from their respective institutions (please note that only full or expedited approvals will be accepted).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Focused Disease Only, IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-FDO-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Focused Disease Only. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
These data may not be used to investigate individual pedigree structures or individual participant genotypes for the purpose of identifying individuals or families; assess variables or proxies that could be considered as stigmatizing an individual or a group; perform phenotype-only analyses (note: investigators may request data for such phenotype-only analyses through NHLBI’s BioLINCC); or explore issues such as non-maternity and non-paternity. All research must be related to the etiology and prevention of morbidity and mortality of the U.S. Population consistent with the demographic distribution in this Study.
Data users will be required to obtain IRB approval for their projects from their respective institutions (please note that only full or expedited approvals will be accepted).
This consent group allows for study of blood pressure, heart or other cardiovascular disease, obesity, diabetes, kidney disease, or lung disease and risk factors for these diseases only. Use of these data to study other diseases (e.g. cancer, schizophrenia) is NOT allowed under the current consent.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Focused Disease Only, IRB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-FDO-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Focused Disease Only. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
These data may not be used to investigate individual pedigree structures or individual participant genotypes for the purpose of identifying individuals or families; assess variables or proxies that could be considered as stigmatizing an individual or a group; perform phenotype-only analyses (note: investigators may request data for such phenotype-only analyses through NHLBI’s BioLINCC); or explore issues such as non-maternity and non-paternity. All research must be related to the etiology and prevention of morbidity and mortality of the U.S. Population consistent with the demographic distribution in this Study.
Data users will be required to obtain IRB approval for their projects from their respective institutions (please note that only full or expedited approvals will be accepted).
This consent group allows for study of blood pressure, heart or other cardiovascular disease, obesity, diabetes, kidney disease, or lung disease and risk factors for these diseases only. Use of these data to study other diseases (e.g. cancer, schizophrenia) is NOT allowed under the current consent.
